==Events==
*  [[70]] &ndash; [[Siege of Jerusalem (70)|Siege of Jerusalem]]: [[Titus]] and his [[Roman legion]]s breach the Second Wall of [[Jerusalem]]. The [[Jews|Jewish]] defenders retreat to the First Wall. The Romans build a [[Investment (military)|circumvallation]], cutting down all trees within fifteen kilometres.
*[[1381]] &ndash; Beginning of the [[Peasants' Revolt]] in [[England]].
*[[1416]] &ndash; The [[Council of Constance]], called by [[Sigismund, Holy Roman Emperor|Emperor Sigismund]], a supporter of [[Antipope John XXIII]], burns [[Jerome of Prague]] following a trial for [[Heresy in Christianity|heresy]].
*[[1431]] &ndash; [[Hundred Years' War]]: in [[Rouen]], [[France]], the 19-year-old [[Joan of Arc]] is [[Death by burning|burned at the stake]] by an English-dominated tribunal. The Roman Catholic Church remembers this day as the celebration of Saint Joan of Arc.
*[[1434]] &ndash; [[Hussite Wars]]: [[Battle of Lipany]] &ndash; effectively ending the war, [[Utraquist]] forces led by Diviš Bořek of Miletínek defeat and almost annihilate [[Taborite]] forces led by [[Prokop the Great]].
*[[1510]] &ndash; During the reign of the [[Zhengde Emperor]], [[Ming Dynasty]] rebel leader [[Zhu Zhifan]] is defeated by commander Qiu Yue, ending the [[Prince of Anhua rebellion]].
*[[1536]] &ndash; King [[Henry VIII of England]] marries [[Jane Seymour]], a [[lady-in-waiting]] to his first two wives.
*[[1539]] &ndash; In [[Florida]], [[Hernando de Soto]] lands at [[Tampa Bay]] with 600 soldiers with the goal of finding [[gold]].
*[[1574]] &ndash; [[Henry III of France|Henry III]] becomes King of [[France]].
*[[1588]] &ndash; The last ship of the [[Spanish Armada]] sets sail from [[Lisbon]] heading for the [[English Channel]].
*[[1631]] &ndash; Publication of ''[[La Gazette|Gazette de France]]'', the first [[France|French]] newspaper.
*[[1635]] &ndash; [[Thirty Years' War]]: the [[Peace of Prague (1635)|Peace of Prague]] is signed.
*[[1642]] &ndash; From this date all honors granted by [[Charles I of England|Charles I]] are retrospectively [[List of Ordinances and Acts of the Parliament of England, 1642–1660|annulled by Parliament]].
*[[1806]] &ndash; Future [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Andrew Jackson]] kills [[Charles Dickinson (historical figure)|Charles Dickinson]] in a duel after Dickinson had accused Jackson's wife of [[bigamy]].
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[Napoleonic Wars]]: [[War of the Sixth Coalition]] &ndash; the [[Treaty of Paris (1814)]] is signed returning French borders to their 1792 extent. [[Napoleon]] I is exiled to [[Elba]].
*[[1815]] &ndash; The [[East Indiaman]] ''[[Arniston (East Indiaman)|Arniston]]'' is wrecked during a storm at [[Waenhuiskrans]], near [[Cape Agulhas]], in present-day [[South Africa]], with the loss of 372 lives.
*[[1832]] &ndash; End of the [[Hambach Festival]] in [[Rhineland-Palatinate]], [[German Confederation|Germany]].
*  1832   &ndash; The [[Rideau Canal]] in eastern [[Ontario]] is opened.
*[[1834]] &ndash; [[Joaquim António de Aguiar]] issues a law extinguishing "all convents, monasteries, colleges, hospices and any other houses of the regular religious orders" in Portugal, earning him the nickname of "The Friar-Killer".
*[[1842]] &ndash; John Francis attempts to murder [[Queen Victoria]] as she drives down [[Constitution Hill, London|Constitution Hill]] in London with [[Albert, Prince Consort|Prince Albert]].
*[[1854]] &ndash; The [[Kansas–Nebraska Act]] becomes law establishing the [[Political divisions of the United States|US territories]] of [[Nebraska]] and [[Kansas]].
*[[1868]] &ndash; Decoration Day (the predecessor of the modern "[[Memorial Day]]") is observed in the [[United States]] for the first time (by "Commander-in-chief of the [[Grand Army of the Republic]]" [[John A. Logan]]'s proclamation on May 5).
*[[1876]] &ndash; Ottoman sultan [[Abdülaziz]] is deposed and succeeded by his nephew [[Murad V]].
*[[1883]] &ndash; In New York City, a rumor that the [[Brooklyn Bridge]] is going to collapse causes a stampede that crushes twelve people.
*[[1899]] &ndash; [[Pearl Hart]], a female outlaw of the [[American frontier|Old West]], robs a stage coach 30 miles southeast of [[Globe, Arizona]].
*[[1911]] &ndash; At the [[Indianapolis Motor Speedway]], the first [[Indianapolis 500]] ends with [[Ray Harroun]] in his ''[[Marmon Motor Car Company|Marmon]] Wasp'' becoming the first winner of the 500-mile auto race.
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[First Balkan War]]: the [[Treaty of London (1913)]], is signed ending the war. [[Albania]] becomes an independent nation.
*[[1914]] &ndash; The new, and then the largest, [[Cunard Line|Cunard]] [[ocean liner]] {{RMS|Aquitania}}, 45,647 tons, sets sails on her maiden voyage from [[Liverpool]], [[England]], to [[New York City|New York, New York]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[Alexander of Greece|Alexander I]] becomes king of [[Greece]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; The [[Lincoln Memorial]] is dedicated in [[Washington, D.C.]].
*[[1925]] &ndash; [[May Thirtieth Movement]]: [[Shanghai Municipal Police]] Force shoot and kill 13 protesting workers.
*[[1932]] &ndash; The [[National Theatre of Greece]] is founded.
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[Memorial Day massacre of 1937|Memorial Day massacre]]: [[Chicago]] police shoot and kill ten labor demonstrators.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Manolis Glezos]] and Apostolos Santas climb the Athenian [[Acropolis]] and tear down the Nazi [[swastika]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: [[Bombing of Cologne in World War II|1000 British bombers launch a 90-minute attack on Cologne, Germany.]]
*[[1948]] &ndash; A dike along the flooding [[Columbia River]] breaks, obliterating [[Vanport, Oregon]], within minutes. Fifteen people die and tens of thousands are left homeless.
*[[1958]] &ndash; Memorial Day: the remains of two unidentified American servicemen, killed in action during World War II and the [[Korean War]] respectively, are buried at the [[Tomb of the Unknowns|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier]] in [[Arlington National Cemetery]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; The [[Auckland Harbour Bridge]], crossing the [[Waitemata Harbour]] in [[Auckland]], [[New Zealand]], is officially opened by [[Governor-General of New Zealand|Governor-General]] [[Charles Lyttelton, 10th Viscount Cobham]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; The long-time Dominican dictator [[Rafael Trujillo]] is assassinated in [[Santo Domingo]], [[Dominican Republic]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; A protest against pro-Catholic discrimination during the [[Buddhist crisis]] is held outside [[South Vietnam]]'s National Assembly, the first open demonstration during the eight-year rule of [[Ngo Dinh Diem]].
*[[1966]] &ndash; The former [[Democratic Republic of the Congo|Congolese]] Prime Minister, [[Évariste Kimba]], and several other politicians are publicly executed in [[Kinshasa]] on the orders of President [[Mobutu Sese Seko|Joseph Mobutu]].
*  1966   &ndash; Launch of ''[[Surveyor 1]]'', the first US spacecraft to land on an extraterrestrial body.
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[Nigeria]]n Eastern Region declares independence as the [[Biafra|Republic of Biafra]], sparking a [[Nigerian Civil War|civil war]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Charles de Gaulle]] reappears publicly after his flight to [[Baden-Baden]], [[Germany]], and dissolves the French National Assembly by a radio appeal. Immediately after, less than one million of his supporters march on the [[Champs-Élysées]] in [[Paris]]. This is the turning point of [[May 1968 events in France]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Mariner program]]: ''[[Mariner 9]]'' is launched to map 70% of the surface, and to study temporal changes in the atmosphere and surface, of [[Mars]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[The Angry Brigade]] goes on trial over a series of 25 bombings throughout the [[United Kingdom]].
*  1972   &ndash; In [[Tel Aviv]], [[Israel]], members of the [[Japanese Red Army]] carry out the [[Lod Airport massacre]], killing 24 people and injuring 78 others.
*[[1974]] &ndash; The [[Airbus A300]] passenger aircraft first enters service.
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Tiananmen Square protests of 1989]]: the 33-foot high "[[Goddess of Democracy]]" [[statue]] is unveiled in [[Tiananmen Square]] by student demonstrators.
*[[1998]] &ndash; A magnitude 6.6 [[earthquake]] hits northern [[Afghanistan]], killing up to 5,000.
*  1998   &ndash; [[Nuclear weapons testing|Nuclear Testing]]: Pakistan conducts an underground test in the [[Kharan Desert]]. It is reported to be a plutonium device with yield of 20kt.
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Depayin massacre]]: at least 70 people associated with the [[National League for Democracy]] are killed by government-sponsored mob in [[Burma]]. [[Aung San Suu Kyi]] fled the scene, but is arrested soon afterwards.
*[[2012]] &ndash; Former [[Liberia]]n president, [[Charles Taylor (Liberian politician)|Charles Taylor]], is sentenced to 50 years in prison for his role in atrocities committed during the [[Sierra Leone Civil War]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[Nigeria]] passes a law [[Same-sex marriage in Nigeria|banning same-sex marriage]].
